snippet: Thousands of lawyers from both presidential campaigns will enter polling places next Tuesday with one central goal: tracking their opponents and, if need be, initiating legal action.
abstract: “Thousands of lawyers from both presidential campaigns will enter polling stations in every battleground state on Election Day, with particular focus on Ohio, to monitor voting and, if need be, initiate legal action;” each side says other side cannot be trusted, and risks of litigation and delayed results are high given likelihood of tight presidential race.
lead_paragraph: Thousands of lawyers from both presidential campaigns will enter polling places next Tuesday with one central goal: tracking their opponents and, if need be, initiating legal action.

headline.main: Campaigns Brace to Sue for Votes in Crucial States
headline.print_headline: Campaigns Brace To Sue for Votes In Crucial States
